Would you like to inspect the original subtitles? These are the user uploaded subtitles that are being translated: 1 00:00:02,089 --> 00:00:04,091 [men counting cadence] Hep, hup! Hep, hup! Hep, hup! Hep, hup! 2 00:00:04,178 --> 00:00:06,267 ♪ Their heads are up their chests are out ♪ 3 00:00:06,354 --> 00:00:08,617 ♪ The arms are swinging in cadence count ♪ 4 00:00:08,704 --> 00:00:10,706 ♪ Sound off ♪♪Sound off♪ 5 00:00:10,793 --> 00:00:12,795 ♪ Sound off ♪♪Sound off♪ 6 00:00:12,882 --> 00:00:16,016 ♪ Cadence count ♪♪One two three four♪ 7 00:00:16,103 --> 00:00:18,105 ♪One two three four♪ 8 00:00:18,192 --> 00:00:20,194 ♪ Eenie meenie miney mo ♪ 9 00:00:20,281 --> 00:00:22,283 ♪ Let's go back and count some mo' ♪ 10 00:00:22,370 --> 00:00:24,415 ♪ Sound off ♪♪Sound off♪ 11 00:00:24,502 --> 00:00:26,591 ♪ Sound off ♪♪Sound off♪ 12 00:00:26,678 --> 00:00:29,159 ♪ Cadence count ♪♪One two three four♪ 13 00:00:29,246 --> 00:00:32,336 ♪One two three four..♪ 14 00:00:32,423 --> 00:00:34,686 [Jimmy] 'Swabbie's got a head like a '49 Ford, Max.' 15 00:00:34,773 --> 00:00:35,992 [Max] 'Come on, Tully. Last round.' 16 00:00:36,079 --> 00:00:37,907 You gotta knock this anchor-clanker out! 17 00:00:37,994 --> 00:00:39,561 'You just got to wear him down, Tully.' 18 00:00:39,648 --> 00:00:40,997 'You're a Marine, okay?' 19 00:00:41,084 --> 00:00:43,043 Come on, Tully. Let's go. 20 00:00:46,916 --> 00:00:48,831 [crowd cheering] 21 00:00:53,227 --> 00:00:55,272 ♪ ...Jody's there when I left ♪♪You're right♪ 22 00:00:55,359 --> 00:00:57,187 ♪ Jody was there when I left ♪♪You're right♪ 23 00:00:57,274 --> 00:00:59,102 ♪ Sound off ♪♪One two..♪ 24 00:01:00,190 --> 00:01:02,975 [crowd cheering] 25 00:01:08,329 --> 00:01:10,940 [grunting] 26 00:01:18,208 --> 00:01:21,081 [crowd cheering] 27 00:01:25,433 --> 00:01:27,913 Listen up, Marines! 28 00:01:28,000 --> 00:01:29,785 Shore leave commences at 1300. 29 00:01:31,265 --> 00:01:33,658 As Marines, you will conduct yourself 30 00:01:33,745 --> 00:01:37,445 with honor, valor, and fidelity. 31 00:01:39,969 --> 00:01:41,884 Outstanding job, PFC Tully. 32 00:01:45,453 --> 00:01:48,282 Private First Class Snow, what in Sam Hill is this? 33 00:01:48,369 --> 00:01:51,067 Sir, it won't stay bloused, sir! 34 00:01:51,154 --> 00:01:53,243 It won't stay bloused because you do not belong 35 00:01:53,330 --> 00:01:55,158 'in my beloved Corps!' 36 00:01:55,245 --> 00:01:57,987 I suggest you unscrew yourself ASAP! 37 00:01:59,293 --> 00:02:01,251 Well, any day, sweetheart! 38 00:02:01,338 --> 00:02:03,688 Sir, yes, sir! 39 00:02:03,775 --> 00:02:07,214 PFC Tully, tell me why I should not cancel liberty 40 00:02:07,301 --> 00:02:10,739 for all hands because of PFC Snowball's personal appearance? 41 00:02:10,826 --> 00:02:13,524 Sir, PFC Snow will square himself away! 42 00:02:13,611 --> 00:02:15,744 Marines take care of their own! That is our code, Sergeant! 43 00:02:15,831 --> 00:02:17,485 Outstanding answer, PFC Tully! 44 00:02:17,572 --> 00:02:19,530 ♪ ...Sound off ♪♪ Cadence count ♪ 45 00:02:19,617 --> 00:02:21,271 ♪One two three four..♪ 46 00:02:21,358 --> 00:02:22,577 Stand by! 47 00:02:23,839 --> 00:02:26,146 ♪ ...Eenie meenie miney mo ♪ 48 00:02:26,233 --> 00:02:28,017 ♪ Let's go back and count some mo' ♪ 49 00:02:28,104 --> 00:02:29,671 ♪ Sound off.. ♪ 50 00:02:29,758 --> 00:02:32,021 Platoon, dismissed! 51 00:02:32,108 --> 00:02:33,675 [soldiers] Aye, aye, Sergeant! 52 00:02:33,762 --> 00:02:35,503 - Do it! - Ooh-rah! 53 00:02:35,590 --> 00:02:37,069 Whoo! 54 00:02:37,157 --> 00:02:39,768 ♪...One two three four♪ 55 00:02:39,855 --> 00:02:41,944 ♪ One two ♪♪Three four..♪ 56 00:02:42,031 --> 00:02:44,903 ♪ Company ♪♪ One two three four ♪ 57 00:02:44,990 --> 00:02:46,557 ♪ Halt ♪♪ Three four ♪♪ 58 00:02:50,257 --> 00:02:53,042 [dramatic music] 59 00:03:08,927 --> 00:03:11,147 [John] 'I love the smell of toxic waste in the morning.' 60 00:03:11,234 --> 00:03:12,757 Hey, you wanna watch your step. 61 00:03:12,844 --> 00:03:14,237 The place is full of stuff 62 00:03:14,324 --> 00:03:15,804 that'll eat your Florsheims for breakfast. 63 00:03:15,891 --> 00:03:17,632 [John] 'Oh, what do we have?' 64 00:03:17,719 --> 00:03:19,111 [Lilly] 'A land test on a real estate deal' 65 00:03:19,199 --> 00:03:21,636 turned up toxic levels of you-name-it. 66 00:03:21,723 --> 00:03:24,595 EPA clean-up crew found the remains inside. 67 00:03:24,682 --> 00:03:26,684 [Scotty] It was adult male shot in the head. 68 00:03:26,771 --> 00:03:29,426 ME tech ballparks it at .38 caliber. 69 00:03:29,513 --> 00:03:30,775 How long has it been here? 70 00:03:30,862 --> 00:03:32,603 Agency says the land hasn't been used 71 00:03:32,690 --> 00:03:35,693 as a legal dump site in over 50 years. 72 00:03:35,780 --> 00:03:36,912 [John] 'We need to find out who had access' 73 00:03:36,999 --> 00:03:37,956 'permission to dump here.' 74 00:03:38,043 --> 00:03:39,654 Yeah, ought to be fun. 75 00:03:39,741 --> 00:03:42,352 'EPA's lawyers have been trying to sort that out for years.' 76 00:03:42,439 --> 00:03:44,049 [Lilly] 'What's that? Dog tags?' 77 00:03:44,136 --> 00:03:48,097 "Tully, James, C. USMC." 78 00:03:51,492 --> 00:03:53,624 Looks like we just found a lost Marine. 79 00:03:58,107 --> 00:04:01,023 [theme music] 80 00:04:32,489 --> 00:04:35,536 [John] 'Marine Private Class James C. Tully.' 81 00:04:35,623 --> 00:04:39,366 Accused of desertion, September 9, 1951. 82 00:04:39,453 --> 00:04:41,629 Stationed aboard the USS Pronto 83 00:04:41,716 --> 00:04:43,761 on his way to do battle in Korea. 84 00:04:43,848 --> 00:04:46,024 The forgotten war. 85 00:04:46,111 --> 00:04:47,678 Disappeared during liberty. 86 00:04:47,765 --> 00:04:49,201 He was supposed to be back on the Pronto 87 00:04:49,289 --> 00:04:52,814 morning of September 9, at 0600 hours. 88 00:04:52,901 --> 00:04:54,206 He never showed. 89 00:04:54,294 --> 00:04:55,686 [Will] 'I think we know why.' 90 00:04:55,773 --> 00:04:57,601 [Lilly] 'The kid was only 17 years old.' 91 00:04:57,688 --> 00:04:59,168 'Got into some kind of trouble.' 92 00:04:59,255 --> 00:05:00,952 [Will] 'On liberty, that's no surprise.' 93 00:05:01,039 --> 00:05:02,432 Drinking, shenanigans. 94 00:05:02,519 --> 00:05:03,825 Yeah, the last hoorah. 95 00:05:03,912 --> 00:05:06,349 Trying to get in as much living as possible. 96 00:05:06,436 --> 00:05:08,569 Pretty high casualty rate in Korea. 97 00:05:08,656 --> 00:05:09,787 Maybe he gets cold feet? 98 00:05:09,874 --> 00:05:11,572 Ah, not likely. 99 00:05:11,659 --> 00:05:15,358 Marines aren't drafted. They enlist or volunteer. 100 00:05:15,445 --> 00:05:17,491 Docks have always been a dangerous place. 101 00:05:17,578 --> 00:05:19,884 He gets separated from his fellow Marines 102 00:05:19,971 --> 00:05:21,973 and runs into some local riff-raff? 103 00:05:22,060 --> 00:05:24,193 The guys in his platoon might know something. 104 00:05:24,280 --> 00:05:26,413 Yeah, if we can track them down. 105 00:05:26,500 --> 00:05:28,240 Well, brother Steve Tully's on his way to Philly 106 00:05:28,328 --> 00:05:29,894 to claim the remains. 107 00:05:29,981 --> 00:05:33,028 A decorated Marine in Vietnam himself. 108 00:05:33,115 --> 00:05:35,509 The father served in World War II. 109 00:05:35,596 --> 00:05:37,467 Whole family of military men. 110 00:05:37,554 --> 00:05:39,513 Ah, must have been a real disgrace 111 00:05:39,600 --> 00:05:41,819 Tully accused of being a deserter. 112 00:05:41,906 --> 00:05:43,386 The family never believed it. 113 00:05:43,473 --> 00:05:45,083 Sent the Naval Board of Corrections 114 00:05:45,170 --> 00:05:48,260 countless letters refuting the unauthorized absence charge.. 115 00:05:48,348 --> 00:05:49,610 ...to no avail. 116 00:05:49,697 --> 00:05:51,002 Trying to reverse a charge like that 117 00:05:51,089 --> 00:05:52,395 with the military bureaucracy 118 00:05:52,482 --> 00:05:55,006 is like getting a battleship to reverse course 119 00:05:55,093 --> 00:05:57,226 slow and unlikely to happen. 120 00:05:57,313 --> 00:05:59,446 It's our job to see this Marine gets his honor back. 121 00:06:05,060 --> 00:06:07,845 [indistinct chattering] 122 00:06:17,681 --> 00:06:19,901 [Will] 'Hey, what the.. My tie!' 123 00:06:19,988 --> 00:06:21,468 That's for aiding and abetting 124 00:06:21,555 --> 00:06:23,470 in a decapitation of my best tie last week. 125 00:06:23,557 --> 00:06:24,862 What makes you think I had anything 126 00:06:24,949 --> 00:06:26,647 to do with that...incident? 127 00:06:26,734 --> 00:06:29,345 Oh, don't worry, your little partner in crime, La Bamba.. 128 00:06:29,432 --> 00:06:30,651 ...he's gonna get his, too. 129 00:06:31,956 --> 00:06:33,610 What up, fellas? 130 00:06:33,697 --> 00:06:35,003 You tell me, Scotty. 131 00:06:37,614 --> 00:06:40,225 [instrumental music] 132 00:06:49,278 --> 00:06:50,801 My father went to his grave 133 00:06:50,888 --> 00:06:53,891 wondering if Jimmy was a coward. 134 00:06:53,978 --> 00:06:55,197 He fought the desertion ruling. 135 00:06:55,284 --> 00:06:56,590 He must have known different in his heart. 136 00:06:56,677 --> 00:06:57,895 [sighs] 137 00:06:57,982 --> 00:07:00,463 Said it wasn't in Jimmy's DNA to desert. 138 00:07:00,550 --> 00:07:03,074 But he still wanted the flag to prove it. 139 00:07:03,161 --> 00:07:05,947 My brother never backed down from a fight in his life. 140 00:07:06,034 --> 00:07:07,644 [Lilly] 'Wondering if you can tell us anything' 141 00:07:07,731 --> 00:07:10,342 about Jimmy might help us with our investigation. 142 00:07:10,430 --> 00:07:13,084 Oh, yeah. Brought this.. 143 00:07:13,171 --> 00:07:14,434 ...postcard he sent us. 144 00:07:14,521 --> 00:07:15,826 It's the last time we heard from him. 145 00:07:17,480 --> 00:07:20,352 "Our sergeant granted us a liberty pass. 146 00:07:20,440 --> 00:07:22,050 '"Me and a couple guys from the platoon' 147 00:07:22,137 --> 00:07:23,486 "are gonna hit the town." 148 00:07:23,573 --> 00:07:25,096 You know who his friends were? 149 00:07:25,183 --> 00:07:27,795 No, I was just a kid when he left for boot camp. 150 00:07:27,882 --> 00:07:29,405 Gave me his baseball glove. 151 00:07:29,492 --> 00:07:31,451 Told me to keep it oiled for him. 152 00:07:31,538 --> 00:07:34,192 Promised to teach me his curve ball when he got back. 153 00:07:34,279 --> 00:07:36,194 Card's postmarked the day he disappeared. 154 00:07:37,979 --> 00:07:40,024 I slept with it under my pillow for years 155 00:07:40,111 --> 00:07:42,026 just thinking it would bring him back. 156 00:07:44,420 --> 00:07:46,727 What about his pocket watch? 157 00:07:46,814 --> 00:07:48,555 Didn't they find it with his, you know.. 158 00:07:48,642 --> 00:07:50,295 Pocket watch? No. 159 00:07:50,382 --> 00:07:51,775 Oh, it definitely would have been on him. 160 00:07:51,862 --> 00:07:53,037 He treasured that watch. 161 00:07:53,124 --> 00:07:55,518 Robbery gone bad? 162 00:07:55,605 --> 00:07:58,347 My father told him it was his duty 163 00:07:58,434 --> 00:08:00,567 to bring the watch back safe 164 00:08:00,654 --> 00:08:02,394 and pass it on to his own son someday. 165 00:08:06,268 --> 00:08:07,835 Never even made it out of Philly. 166 00:08:12,187 --> 00:08:14,319 [Will] 'Sergeant Chaney, they said we could find you here.' 167 00:08:18,149 --> 00:08:21,065 I volunteer twice a week and school some of these men 168 00:08:21,152 --> 00:08:22,545 in checkers, just to let them know 169 00:08:22,632 --> 00:08:25,113 that their sacrifice still means something. 170 00:08:25,200 --> 00:08:26,680 Oh, wondering what you remember 171 00:08:26,767 --> 00:08:30,727 about Private First Class Jimmy Tully. 172 00:08:30,814 --> 00:08:33,643 One of nine guys that went to Korea came back 173 00:08:33,730 --> 00:08:35,645 in a body bag, and you're asking me 174 00:08:35,732 --> 00:08:38,039 about a coward that went AWOL? 175 00:08:38,126 --> 00:08:39,867 You were his platoon sergeant, right? 176 00:08:39,954 --> 00:08:42,478 - Mm-hmm. - That type of behavior fit? 177 00:08:42,565 --> 00:08:44,132 Well, the kid was a hell of a boxer. 178 00:08:44,219 --> 00:08:46,961 He beat the tar out of the Navy's best puncher 179 00:08:47,048 --> 00:08:49,398 the day of shore leave but there's a hell of a difference 180 00:08:49,485 --> 00:08:53,794 between taking a punch and staring down enemy fire. 181 00:08:53,881 --> 00:08:55,970 His body turned up yesterday. 182 00:08:56,057 --> 00:08:58,015 We think he got killed on shore leave. 183 00:08:58,102 --> 00:08:59,713 'Anyone in his platoon have a problem with him?' 184 00:08:59,800 --> 00:09:03,586 Whoa! If Tully was killed it wasn't by another Marine. 185 00:09:03,673 --> 00:09:06,023 Any idea which of his friends he might have hit Philly with? 186 00:09:06,110 --> 00:09:09,157 Yeah, there was a guy named Max, um.. 187 00:09:09,244 --> 00:09:12,813 ...Max Heid, Heidhorn. Heidhorn, yeah. 188 00:09:12,900 --> 00:09:14,684 He was a real clown. 189 00:09:14,771 --> 00:09:16,251 We'll look into it. 190 00:09:16,338 --> 00:09:18,253 Hey, detectives.. 191 00:09:18,340 --> 00:09:20,690 ...if a guy doesn't come back to the ship 192 00:09:20,777 --> 00:09:22,039 I have no other choice 193 00:09:22,126 --> 00:09:23,824 'but to declare him a deserter.' 194 00:09:28,611 --> 00:09:32,049 Max Heidhorn? Detectives Rush, Miller. 195 00:09:32,136 --> 00:09:34,399 'Thanks for coming in.' 196 00:09:34,486 --> 00:09:35,749 A fan of the ponies? 197 00:09:35,836 --> 00:09:37,228 I like to lay a few bets 198 00:09:37,315 --> 00:09:39,274 here and there, keep things interesting. 199 00:09:39,361 --> 00:09:41,015 - You got a system? - Yeah. 200 00:09:41,102 --> 00:09:43,495 It's called "Win some, lose some." 201 00:09:43,583 --> 00:09:44,801 'But you didn't ask me down here' 202 00:09:44,888 --> 00:09:47,674 to pick up tips on the sport of kings. 203 00:09:47,761 --> 00:09:49,719 Understand you and Jimmy Tully were friends. 204 00:09:49,806 --> 00:09:53,070 Sure were. We survived boot camp together. 205 00:09:53,157 --> 00:09:54,550 Were you with him on shore leave? 206 00:09:54,637 --> 00:09:58,685 Me and about 500 other Marines and sailors. 207 00:09:58,772 --> 00:09:59,990 When's the last time you saw him? 208 00:10:00,077 --> 00:10:02,079 [sighs] That'd be hard to forget. 209 00:10:02,166 --> 00:10:05,387 [Peggy Lee singing "If You Turn Me Down"] 210 00:10:05,474 --> 00:10:07,389 [Max] 'Hey, Tully, get in line.' 211 00:10:07,476 --> 00:10:09,130 Alright, come on, I'm buying. 212 00:10:09,217 --> 00:10:12,916 Get an anchor and globe or, uh, maybe one of them hula girls. 213 00:10:13,003 --> 00:10:14,439 [Jimmy] 'I ain't got time, Max.' 214 00:10:19,662 --> 00:10:21,577 Those Navy squids don't do so well on land. 215 00:10:21,664 --> 00:10:22,970 I'll say. 216 00:10:23,057 --> 00:10:25,189 ♪ If you turn me down ♪ 217 00:10:25,276 --> 00:10:26,626 ♪ Down down down.. ♪ 218 00:10:28,715 --> 00:10:29,759 Valentine red. 219 00:10:32,370 --> 00:10:33,633 Color of your lips. 220 00:10:35,286 --> 00:10:36,244 Thanks. 221 00:10:37,767 --> 00:10:39,290 I've gotta dash. 222 00:10:41,771 --> 00:10:44,948 Hey, Tully, what the hell you gawking at? 223 00:10:45,035 --> 00:10:47,124 See that? 224 00:10:47,211 --> 00:10:49,561 Yeah, I sure did. 225 00:10:49,649 --> 00:10:51,912 'Another barnacle looking to latch onto some sailor.' 226 00:10:51,999 --> 00:10:53,740 'Man, the girls I told you about at this place' 227 00:10:53,827 --> 00:10:55,524 do a whole lot more than just look, baby. 228 00:10:55,611 --> 00:10:56,917 'You coming?' 229 00:10:57,004 --> 00:10:58,483 What, are you kidding? 230 00:10:58,570 --> 00:11:00,137 Just met the girl of my dreams. 231 00:11:00,224 --> 00:11:02,879 Hey, anybody want to see the Liberty Bell with me? 232 00:11:02,966 --> 00:11:05,273 Yeah. Dumbbell meets Liberty Bell. 233 00:11:05,360 --> 00:11:06,796 Take it easy on the kid, Max. 234 00:11:06,883 --> 00:11:08,232 You know, good thing you got old Tully here 235 00:11:08,319 --> 00:11:10,060 always sticking up for you, Snowball. 236 00:11:10,147 --> 00:11:12,976 Maybe he can, um, chaperone your little sightseeing tour. 237 00:11:13,063 --> 00:11:14,325 [Jimmy] 'I'm going across the street.' 238 00:11:14,412 --> 00:11:16,893 Hey, no, no, that's a Navy bar. 239 00:11:16,980 --> 00:11:18,852 Karnow's got to be sore about you beating him. 240 00:11:18,939 --> 00:11:21,637 Yeah, well, I beat him fair and square. 241 00:11:21,724 --> 00:11:23,160 Where I'm going, at least you won't have 242 00:11:23,247 --> 00:11:26,120 to fight sailors off just to get a dance. 243 00:11:26,207 --> 00:11:27,295 You know where to find me, punchy. 244 00:11:27,382 --> 00:11:28,862 Roger that, devil dog. 245 00:11:32,169 --> 00:11:35,607 Tattoo was the last thing I remember about shore leave. 246 00:11:35,695 --> 00:11:38,915 Almost didn't make it back to the ship due to the whiskey.. 247 00:11:39,002 --> 00:11:40,482 ...and a redheaded girl. 248 00:11:40,569 --> 00:11:43,398 This Karnow, he and Tully have a history? 249 00:11:43,485 --> 00:11:45,356 "Mean Gene" Karnow. 250 00:11:45,443 --> 00:11:48,620 Tully gave that bastard a really good pasting 251 00:11:48,708 --> 00:11:51,841 at a smoker right before we got our liberty passes. 252 00:11:51,928 --> 00:11:53,669 Fight over what? 253 00:11:53,756 --> 00:11:56,237 Boxing match over bragging rights. 254 00:11:56,324 --> 00:11:58,543 Tully always took that Semper Fi 255 00:11:58,630 --> 00:12:01,459 "always faithful" business seriously. 256 00:12:01,546 --> 00:12:02,809 Me, on the other hand.. 257 00:12:02,896 --> 00:12:04,854 Karnow the type to hold a grudge? 258 00:12:04,941 --> 00:12:06,682 Well, first off, he was a Swabbie. 259 00:12:06,769 --> 00:12:09,467 No love lost between Marines and sailors. 260 00:12:14,124 --> 00:12:15,996 [indistinct chattering] 261 00:12:18,825 --> 00:12:20,217 [Nick] 'Gene Karnow?' 262 00:12:22,567 --> 00:12:24,569 Easy. Take it easy there, Dragnet. 263 00:12:27,181 --> 00:12:28,791 You guys looking for lessons? 264 00:12:28,878 --> 00:12:30,314 We're here about Jimmy Tully. 265 00:12:32,360 --> 00:12:35,015 - What's he want, a rematch? - He's dead. 266 00:12:35,102 --> 00:12:37,191 Killed on shore leave, the night he knocked you out. 267 00:12:37,278 --> 00:12:38,758 How'd that happen? 268 00:12:38,845 --> 00:12:40,847 We were just about to ask you the same question. 269 00:12:40,934 --> 00:12:42,239 You think I killed him because he got 270 00:12:42,326 --> 00:12:43,719 over a few lucky punches? 271 00:12:43,806 --> 00:12:46,069 So no hard feelings between you and Tully? 272 00:12:46,156 --> 00:12:48,898 Hell, that match with Tully and me on board ship 273 00:12:48,985 --> 00:12:50,987 but, that was my last fight. 274 00:12:51,074 --> 00:12:53,337 Boiler blew up on the way to Korea 275 00:12:53,424 --> 00:12:56,471 and drove a six-inch piece of steel into my shoulder. 276 00:12:58,081 --> 00:13:00,040 Jab wasn't much good after that. 277 00:13:00,127 --> 00:13:01,693 - You see Tully that night? - Yeah. 278 00:13:01,781 --> 00:13:03,347 [chuckles] Sure. 279 00:13:03,434 --> 00:13:07,221 Guy had brass ones, walking into a Navy bar. 280 00:13:09,092 --> 00:13:11,921 [Keely Smith singing "Yeah Yeah Yeah"] 281 00:13:21,975 --> 00:13:24,325 ♪ Here is a boogie that you should know ♪ 282 00:13:24,412 --> 00:13:26,631 ♪ You do it every time you're feeling low ♪ 283 00:13:26,718 --> 00:13:29,069 ♪ There's nothing like it anywhere ♪ 284 00:13:29,156 --> 00:13:31,419 ♪ All you gotta do is holler yeah.. ♪ 285 00:13:31,506 --> 00:13:32,812 You got lucky, jarhead. 286 00:13:34,726 --> 00:13:36,511 - I don't want any trouble. - Yeah, what do you want then? 287 00:13:36,598 --> 00:13:37,555 A dance. 288 00:13:41,124 --> 00:13:42,691 Good luck and goodnight. 289 00:13:42,778 --> 00:13:45,172 She's shot down every sailor in here including yours truly. 290 00:13:45,259 --> 00:13:46,782 I'll take my chances. 291 00:13:46,869 --> 00:13:50,220 ♪ ...Yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah yeah all the time ♪ 292 00:13:50,307 --> 00:13:52,657 ♪ I say hug he says yeah.. ♪ 293 00:13:52,744 --> 00:13:54,398 [clears throat] 294 00:13:54,485 --> 00:13:56,226 You lost this. 295 00:13:56,313 --> 00:13:58,576 "Brown, Sanford and Mullins Attorneys at Law." 296 00:13:59,882 --> 00:14:02,015 So which one are you? 297 00:14:02,102 --> 00:14:03,886 I'm just a stenographer right now. 298 00:14:03,973 --> 00:14:06,062 Tomorrow's my first day on the job. 299 00:14:06,149 --> 00:14:09,979 But someday I'm gonna have my own card just like that. 300 00:14:10,066 --> 00:14:11,720 I'd offer to buy you a drink but it looks like you're doing 301 00:14:11,807 --> 00:14:13,374 just fine in that department. 302 00:14:13,461 --> 00:14:15,245 You wanna buy me a drink, you gotta get in line. 303 00:14:16,986 --> 00:14:18,161 The sailor at the end of the bar says 304 00:14:18,248 --> 00:14:20,511 you're the toughest thing in here. 305 00:14:20,598 --> 00:14:22,862 Think he might've been right. 306 00:14:22,949 --> 00:14:25,995 I thought Marines were supposed to be brave. 307 00:14:26,082 --> 00:14:29,216 Well, a good Marine must improvise 308 00:14:29,303 --> 00:14:31,783 adapt and overcome. 309 00:14:34,308 --> 00:14:35,918 Is that why you're in a Navy bar? 310 00:14:36,005 --> 00:14:37,920 The one thing I swore I'd do before I shipped off 311 00:14:38,007 --> 00:14:40,009 was dance with a pretty girl. 312 00:14:40,096 --> 00:14:41,837 - Is that where I come in? - Affirmative. 313 00:14:46,537 --> 00:14:49,062 Alright, but I don't dance with strangers. 314 00:14:49,149 --> 00:14:50,977 Jimmy Tully, Wilkes Barre, Pennsylvania. 315 00:14:52,674 --> 00:14:55,546 Nora Lee, Philadelphia born and bred. 316 00:14:55,633 --> 00:14:58,114 Miss Nora Lee from Philadelphia, born and bred 317 00:14:58,201 --> 00:14:59,289 would you care to dance? 318 00:15:04,338 --> 00:15:05,600 Why don't you drop anchor someplace else? 319 00:15:05,687 --> 00:15:06,818 You got a problem, pal? 320 00:15:06,906 --> 00:15:08,516 Besides you guys taking over our bars 321 00:15:08,603 --> 00:15:10,083 and bird-dogging our women? 322 00:15:10,170 --> 00:15:11,388 Not tonight. 323 00:15:14,914 --> 00:15:17,351 You better have a lot of bullets in that gun, civilian. 324 00:15:19,005 --> 00:15:21,137 [Ray] Get off me. 325 00:15:21,224 --> 00:15:24,488 Never thought I'd be defending a jarhead's right 326 00:15:24,575 --> 00:15:26,664 to dance with the prettiest girl in the bar. 327 00:15:26,751 --> 00:15:28,318 This tough guy, he got a name? 328 00:15:28,405 --> 00:15:30,755 Nah, didn't bother asking. 329 00:15:30,842 --> 00:15:32,714 Introduced him to the sidewalk pretty good. 330 00:15:32,801 --> 00:15:35,412 Well, maybe he waited around outside for Tully. 331 00:15:35,499 --> 00:15:38,807 I couldn't tell you, because the second 332 00:15:38,894 --> 00:15:42,202 prettiest girl in the bar was so impressed 333 00:15:42,289 --> 00:15:44,682 with my bravery, she asked me to dance. 334 00:15:44,769 --> 00:15:47,337 Been together 55 years. 335 00:15:47,424 --> 00:15:49,035 You remember anything else about this guy? 336 00:15:49,122 --> 00:15:53,343 Yeah, had a dock workers' union patch on his jacket. 337 00:15:53,430 --> 00:15:54,997 That's a funny thing to remember. 338 00:15:55,084 --> 00:15:57,478 I was a snipe, you know, an engine room rat. 339 00:15:57,565 --> 00:15:59,784 I had to deal with sand crabs like that all the time. 340 00:16:00,960 --> 00:16:02,396 Thanks for your time. 341 00:16:02,483 --> 00:16:04,050 You know, if you ever want some lessons 342 00:16:04,137 --> 00:16:06,748 come on down and we'll lace 'em up, okay? 343 00:16:06,835 --> 00:16:09,316 My partner needs more than that. 344 00:16:09,403 --> 00:16:12,275 You're what, 50 push-ups from the cover ofGQ? 345 00:16:12,362 --> 00:16:14,756 I wouldn't be so sure about that, big fella. 346 00:16:14,843 --> 00:16:16,279 I could teach him something that'd wipe 347 00:16:16,366 --> 00:16:17,977 that smirk right off your face. 348 00:16:19,891 --> 00:16:22,546 Oh, no offense, detective. Sorry. 349 00:16:27,595 --> 00:16:29,205 Come on, come on.. 350 00:16:29,292 --> 00:16:30,946 Come on. Let's go 351 00:16:31,033 --> 00:16:32,643 [Lilly] 'Gunwale, your old haunt?' 352 00:16:32,730 --> 00:16:34,558 [John] Navy bar, tied a few on here. 353 00:16:34,645 --> 00:16:35,864 Some things never change. 354 00:16:35,951 --> 00:16:37,257 I'll bet she still remembers what I drink. 355 00:16:40,303 --> 00:16:43,915 John, long time no see. 356 00:16:44,003 --> 00:16:46,353 Irish whiskey and a beer back? 357 00:16:46,440 --> 00:16:47,745 [John] 'Nah, on duty.' 358 00:16:47,832 --> 00:16:50,357 - This is Detective Rush. - 'Hey.' 359 00:16:50,444 --> 00:16:52,837 We're wondering if you remember Jimmy Tully. 360 00:16:52,924 --> 00:16:54,578 Marine back in '51. 361 00:16:54,665 --> 00:16:57,451 I'm good, sugar, but I'm not that good. 362 00:16:57,538 --> 00:17:00,715 Witness said he had words over a girl with a local tough guy. 363 00:17:00,802 --> 00:17:02,934 In the Gunwale? Imagine that. 364 00:17:03,022 --> 00:17:05,241 That tough guy wore a dock workers' union patch 365 00:17:05,328 --> 00:17:07,983 on his jacket. Flashed a gun. 366 00:17:08,070 --> 00:17:09,637 Could be Ray Lisi. 367 00:17:09,724 --> 00:17:11,552 'Hall of fame jackass.' 368 00:17:11,639 --> 00:17:14,207 86'd him from the Gunwale, over a decade ago. 369 00:17:14,294 --> 00:17:15,556 He ever do time? 370 00:17:15,643 --> 00:17:17,427 He did a good stretch at Frackville 371 00:17:17,514 --> 00:17:19,777 for beating a union scab. 372 00:17:19,864 --> 00:17:22,998 The guy's sucking his meals down through a straw now. 373 00:17:23,085 --> 00:17:24,739 Where's Lisi park at these days? 374 00:17:24,826 --> 00:17:27,872 Over at Ruby's with the rest of his old dock buddies. 375 00:17:27,959 --> 00:17:29,613 'Probably already got his drunk on.' 376 00:17:29,700 --> 00:17:32,964 And he likes cops even less than Marines. 377 00:17:33,052 --> 00:17:34,444 We'll keep that in mind. 378 00:17:34,531 --> 00:17:36,707 - Thanks, Sue. - Okay. 379 00:17:36,794 --> 00:17:38,405 Hey. 380 00:17:38,492 --> 00:17:41,625 He tries to throw a bottle at you, like he did me.. 381 00:17:41,712 --> 00:17:43,105 We'll return the favor. 382 00:17:48,502 --> 00:17:50,591 Boss, think I made some headway 383 00:17:50,678 --> 00:17:52,027 on the oil drum Tully was found in. 384 00:17:52,114 --> 00:17:53,594 What do you got? 385 00:17:53,681 --> 00:17:55,944 List of about 50 entities that could've dumped there. 386 00:17:56,031 --> 00:17:58,294 Of the most interest, the Navy and the shipyard. 387 00:17:58,381 --> 00:17:59,687 Oil drum could have come off a ship. 388 00:17:59,774 --> 00:18:01,906 - Yep. - Check naval base records. 389 00:18:01,993 --> 00:18:04,387 When I served, the military kept a paper trail a mile long 390 00:18:04,474 --> 00:18:06,259 for every belt buckle, bullet and mess kit. 391 00:18:06,346 --> 00:18:07,260 Oh, joy. 392 00:18:08,739 --> 00:18:10,567 Oh! So where's this old dock worker? 393 00:18:10,654 --> 00:18:12,439 I hear he took a swing at the cop that picked him up. 394 00:18:12,526 --> 00:18:15,094 Ray Lisi? Scotty's got him in the box now. 395 00:18:18,749 --> 00:18:20,925 [Scotty] 'I'm gonna make you pick up after yourself, Ray.' 396 00:18:21,012 --> 00:18:23,276 You mind telling me what this is all about, junior? 397 00:18:24,581 --> 00:18:26,670 Sure, pops. Either you tell me about 398 00:18:26,757 --> 00:18:29,978 the last time you saw Jimmy Tully.. 399 00:18:30,065 --> 00:18:32,285 ...or I lock you up for taking a swing at that cop. 400 00:18:32,372 --> 00:18:33,982 Jimmy who? 401 00:18:34,069 --> 00:18:35,766 We got an eyewitness says you flashed a gun at him. 402 00:18:35,853 --> 00:18:37,246 Oh, that's interesting. 403 00:18:37,333 --> 00:18:40,031 It gets better, see, 'cause this Marine got shot. 404 00:18:41,859 --> 00:18:43,513 Well, isn't that what they sign up for? 405 00:18:46,734 --> 00:18:47,952 Pulled your sheet. 406 00:18:48,039 --> 00:18:49,302 'You beat a guy with a .38' 407 00:18:49,389 --> 00:18:50,694 'not long after Tully disappeared.' 408 00:18:50,781 --> 00:18:52,218 It's the same caliber killed Tully. 409 00:18:52,305 --> 00:18:55,221 Guy was a scab. He kept falling on my gun. 410 00:18:55,308 --> 00:18:56,744 Lucky I didn't pull the trigger. 411 00:18:56,831 --> 00:18:59,355 Well, you couldn't beat Tully, so you shot him. 412 00:18:59,442 --> 00:19:00,487 Keep trawling. 413 00:19:01,879 --> 00:19:04,317 I'm done with you, Ray. 414 00:19:04,404 --> 00:19:07,189 Either you talk or a few friends of that cop you swung at 415 00:19:07,276 --> 00:19:09,191 are gonna come in here and tuck you in for the night. 416 00:19:12,325 --> 00:19:14,892 Lucky bastard was doing just fine when I left him. 417 00:19:16,851 --> 00:19:20,028 ♪ I met a chick who was real great ♪ 418 00:19:20,115 --> 00:19:21,986 ♪ Do-dah do-dah ♪ 419 00:19:22,073 --> 00:19:23,336 ♪ And I fixed her up for.. ♪ 420 00:19:23,423 --> 00:19:25,076 [Nora] 'Greatest city in the world.' 421 00:19:25,164 --> 00:19:26,904 [Jimmy] 'A lot of guys on the ship from Philly.' 422 00:19:26,991 --> 00:19:30,299 'Maybe I'll make it my home someday, too.' 423 00:19:30,386 --> 00:19:32,040 Oh, it's already 10 o'clock. 424 00:19:32,127 --> 00:19:33,389 I'm sorry, I'm keeping you 425 00:19:33,476 --> 00:19:36,305 with your big first day tomorrow. 426 00:19:36,392 --> 00:19:39,308 My friend dragged me along with her 427 00:19:39,395 --> 00:19:41,180 and I wasn't expecting to meet someone like you. 428 00:19:41,267 --> 00:19:42,920 I know, me neither. 429 00:19:43,007 --> 00:19:45,445 We got those clumsy sailors to thank for that. 430 00:19:45,532 --> 00:19:48,230 You probably would've found some other pretty girl to dance with. 431 00:19:48,317 --> 00:19:49,971 But I found you. 432 00:19:53,975 --> 00:19:55,150 What's the matter? 433 00:19:55,237 --> 00:19:57,239 Aren't you afraid of going over there? 434 00:19:57,326 --> 00:19:59,154 Marines aren't supposed to show fear. 435 00:19:59,241 --> 00:20:01,417 Save the slogans for your buddies. 436 00:20:01,504 --> 00:20:02,853 I'm serious, Jimmy. 437 00:20:06,161 --> 00:20:08,685 Look, any guy who tells you he isn't afraid is a liar. 438 00:20:08,772 --> 00:20:11,297 'My father served, and so did his father.' 439 00:20:11,384 --> 00:20:12,950 It's what the men in my family do. 440 00:20:15,866 --> 00:20:16,998 Hey. 441 00:20:19,827 --> 00:20:23,091 What if I lose you, as soon as I found you? 442 00:20:27,051 --> 00:20:28,749 I still owe you that dance, remember? 443 00:20:28,836 --> 00:20:31,360 Dance marathon? Now you're talking. 444 00:20:31,447 --> 00:20:33,319 Marine and fastest typist in the steno pool? 445 00:20:33,406 --> 00:20:35,277 We'll be the couple to beat. 446 00:20:35,364 --> 00:20:38,280 - Nora! - What is it with this guy? 447 00:20:38,367 --> 00:20:40,761 He works down at the docks with my father. I can handle him. 448 00:20:40,848 --> 00:20:43,329 If he lays one finger on you, I'm gonna clean his clock. 449 00:20:46,201 --> 00:20:48,247 What're you doing, Ray? 450 00:20:48,334 --> 00:20:50,292 This guy's not gonna be here for you like I am. 451 00:20:50,379 --> 00:20:51,815 I appreciate you looking out for me 452 00:20:51,902 --> 00:20:53,861 but you need to go home. 453 00:20:53,948 --> 00:20:55,950 Please. Do it for me. 454 00:20:58,996 --> 00:21:01,390 [indistinct chattering] 455 00:21:05,699 --> 00:21:07,962 Oh, I never been much for that lovey-dovey crud 456 00:21:08,049 --> 00:21:11,357 but...I think she was real smitten. 457 00:21:11,444 --> 00:21:13,663 You don't strike me as the observant type, Ray. 458 00:21:15,056 --> 00:21:17,406 I did not shoot that jarhead. 459 00:21:17,493 --> 00:21:18,755 Well, he embarrassed you in front of your girl. 460 00:21:18,842 --> 00:21:20,409 She wasn't my girl. 461 00:21:20,496 --> 00:21:22,324 The most she ever did was let me buy her a drink. 462 00:21:26,415 --> 00:21:27,895 Better hope she backs that up. 463 00:21:36,382 --> 00:21:37,905 [Lilly] 'Your husband?' 464 00:21:37,992 --> 00:21:40,429 I lost him ten years ago. 465 00:21:40,516 --> 00:21:42,997 Ben was a good man. He was there for me. 466 00:21:43,084 --> 00:21:45,478 Don't make men like they used to. 467 00:21:45,565 --> 00:21:48,089 Was Tully around when you started dating Ben? 468 00:21:48,176 --> 00:21:51,484 I know what you're thinking, but I wasn't that kind of girl. 469 00:21:51,571 --> 00:21:54,748 I met Ben a year later. A friend set us up. 470 00:21:58,360 --> 00:22:01,450 - That's my son, Peter. - Handsome. 471 00:22:01,537 --> 00:22:03,757 I thought you wanted to ask me about Jimmy Tully. 472 00:22:03,844 --> 00:22:06,629 A guy named Ray Lisi said you were with Jimmy 473 00:22:06,716 --> 00:22:07,978 the night he disappeared. 474 00:22:08,065 --> 00:22:09,632 We met at the Gunwale. 475 00:22:09,719 --> 00:22:12,243 Then hit a dance marathon. 476 00:22:12,331 --> 00:22:15,899 "Marine and fastest typist in the steno pool." 477 00:22:15,986 --> 00:22:17,118 'That's what he said.' 478 00:22:17,205 --> 00:22:20,295 - What about after that? - After that? 479 00:22:20,382 --> 00:22:24,604 I would've given him my heart but fate wouldn't have it. 480 00:22:24,691 --> 00:22:27,520 [Nat King Cole singing "Mona Lisa"] 481 00:22:32,263 --> 00:22:33,830 What? 482 00:22:33,917 --> 00:22:36,355 Just seeing if your boyfriend Ray comes out to stop me. 483 00:22:36,442 --> 00:22:38,444 Stop you from what? 484 00:22:38,531 --> 00:22:41,185 Smuggling you on the ship. 485 00:22:41,272 --> 00:22:43,144 'Come on, I'll buy you a soda.' 486 00:22:43,231 --> 00:22:44,928 Thank you. 487 00:22:47,714 --> 00:22:49,629 I sure am gonna miss you. 488 00:22:49,716 --> 00:22:52,545 You'll forget what I look like minute the ship leaves port. 489 00:22:52,632 --> 00:22:55,069 Not if you give me a photo of yourself. 490 00:22:55,156 --> 00:22:56,462 Do I look like the kind of girl 491 00:22:56,549 --> 00:22:58,464 who carries photos of herself around? 492 00:23:00,988 --> 00:23:03,164 Come on, let's fix that. 493 00:23:03,251 --> 00:23:05,471 [laughs] Come on. Come on. 494 00:23:07,342 --> 00:23:10,345 ♪ ...Or is this your way ♪ 495 00:23:10,432 --> 00:23:15,176 ♪ To hide a broken heart? ♪ 496 00:23:15,263 --> 00:23:17,700 ♪ Many dreams have been brought.. ♪ 497 00:23:17,787 --> 00:23:19,223 You're supposed to look at the camera. 498 00:23:19,310 --> 00:23:21,095 What if I don't want to? 499 00:23:21,182 --> 00:23:22,705 We're going to have to keep doing this 500 00:23:22,792 --> 00:23:24,011 until you get it right. 501 00:23:24,098 --> 00:23:25,491 Or we could do this. 502 00:23:30,365 --> 00:23:33,107 ♪ ...Are you warm are you real ♪ 503 00:23:34,238 --> 00:23:36,719 ♪ Mona Lisa.. ♪ 504 00:23:36,806 --> 00:23:38,634 Private First Class Tully? 505 00:23:38,721 --> 00:23:39,853 [Jimmy] 'Yes?' 506 00:23:39,940 --> 00:23:41,332 Need to come with us. 507 00:23:41,420 --> 00:23:43,596 Jimmy? Jimmy? What's happening? 508 00:23:43,683 --> 00:23:45,249 I don't know. 509 00:23:45,336 --> 00:23:46,555 I'll find you. 510 00:23:48,296 --> 00:23:52,692 ♪ ...Mona Lisa ♪ 511 00:23:52,779 --> 00:23:56,783 ♪ Mona Lisa ♪♪ 512 00:23:56,870 --> 00:23:58,175 That was the last time I saw him. 513 00:23:58,262 --> 00:24:00,090 What did shore patrol want with Tully? 514 00:24:00,177 --> 00:24:01,918 I don't know. 515 00:24:02,005 --> 00:24:03,354 He never came back. 516 00:24:06,357 --> 00:24:09,926 Anything else you remember, give us a call. 517 00:24:10,013 --> 00:24:12,581 Thank you for letting me know what happened to him. 518 00:24:12,668 --> 00:24:14,148 'I only knew Jimmy for a few hours' 519 00:24:14,235 --> 00:24:16,542 but I never forgot him. 520 00:24:23,505 --> 00:24:25,028 Hey, John, naval clerk dug up 521 00:24:25,115 --> 00:24:26,987 the ship's disciplinary log book. 522 00:24:27,074 --> 00:24:28,945 Logbook have an entry of sending out shore patrol? 523 00:24:29,032 --> 00:24:30,643 Yeah, sent to question Tully's entire platoon. 524 00:24:30,730 --> 00:24:32,253 Log entry said they were looking 525 00:24:32,340 --> 00:24:35,082 for a Private First Class Lenny Snow suspected of taking 526 00:24:35,169 --> 00:24:37,867 a Navy officer's pearl-handled .38 revolver. 527 00:24:37,954 --> 00:24:39,216 Could be our murder weapon. 528 00:24:39,303 --> 00:24:40,957 Gun was never recovered. 529 00:24:41,044 --> 00:24:43,046 Snow spent the crossing to the Korean Peninsula 530 00:24:43,133 --> 00:24:45,179 below decks in the ship's brig. 531 00:24:45,266 --> 00:24:46,615 Well, let's put him in our box 532 00:24:46,702 --> 00:24:49,009 see what he's got to say about this gun. 533 00:24:52,273 --> 00:24:54,144 Had a look at your service record. 534 00:24:54,231 --> 00:24:57,496 'Navy Cross, Bronze Star.' 535 00:24:57,583 --> 00:24:59,585 'That's some tour of duty.' 536 00:24:59,672 --> 00:25:01,369 I prefer not to talk about it. 537 00:25:05,547 --> 00:25:07,897 - Why not? - Did you serve, detective? 538 00:25:09,551 --> 00:25:11,597 Navy. 539 00:25:11,684 --> 00:25:14,382 - Vietnam? - River Rat unit. 540 00:25:14,469 --> 00:25:18,342 Then you know a lot of good men never made it back. 541 00:25:18,429 --> 00:25:20,344 'Doesn't seem right to be making a fuss over a bunch' 542 00:25:20,431 --> 00:25:21,824 of medals and ribbons. 543 00:25:23,522 --> 00:25:26,002 I did what I had to do. Others gave more. 544 00:25:26,089 --> 00:25:28,265 You straightened yourself out after shore leave, though. 545 00:25:28,352 --> 00:25:31,051 [Lenny] 'I'll admit I wasn't the most squared-away Marine in my unit.' 546 00:25:31,138 --> 00:25:33,488 But I didn't take that officer's weapon. 547 00:25:33,575 --> 00:25:35,838 Then why'd shore patrol think you did? 548 00:25:35,925 --> 00:25:38,188 Oh, I got blamed for everything. 549 00:25:38,275 --> 00:25:40,539 Didn't help that Sergeant Chaney had it in for me. 550 00:25:40,626 --> 00:25:42,149 Well, you see Tully that night on shore leave? 551 00:25:42,236 --> 00:25:44,151 Yeah. 552 00:25:44,238 --> 00:25:46,936 Tried to help me out of the pickle I was in with that gun. 553 00:25:48,982 --> 00:25:51,593 [indistinct announcement on PA] 554 00:25:55,510 --> 00:25:58,165 [intense music] 555 00:26:01,081 --> 00:26:02,473 [Jimmy] 'Where the hell have you been?' 556 00:26:02,561 --> 00:26:04,214 I been looking all over town for you. 557 00:26:06,173 --> 00:26:07,696 - I'm in trouble. - 'Yeah, I know.' 558 00:26:07,783 --> 00:26:09,350 Shore patrol gave me the third degree about you. 559 00:26:09,437 --> 00:26:12,745 I didn't take that revolver. You gotta believe me. 560 00:26:12,832 --> 00:26:14,921 Then you better start convincing me. 561 00:26:15,008 --> 00:26:16,313 'Cause I just left the girl of my dreams. 562 00:26:16,400 --> 00:26:18,098 I don't know what happened. 563 00:26:18,185 --> 00:26:19,447 Sergeant Chaney had Max and me 564 00:26:19,534 --> 00:26:21,014 on police detail in officer quarters. 565 00:26:21,101 --> 00:26:22,450 You and Max? 566 00:26:22,537 --> 00:26:24,670 You can ask him. 567 00:26:24,757 --> 00:26:27,411 I never even saw the weapon. 568 00:26:27,498 --> 00:26:30,284 - Scout's honor. - You see Max go inside? 569 00:26:30,371 --> 00:26:33,113 He wanted to see how squared away an officer kept his rack. 570 00:26:33,200 --> 00:26:35,637 'You know Max. He was just jokin' around.' 571 00:26:37,291 --> 00:26:39,902 - You think Max took it? - If you didn't. 572 00:26:41,643 --> 00:26:44,298 What's it matter? Huh? 573 00:26:44,385 --> 00:26:46,605 Sarge is right, I'll never be a good Marine. 574 00:26:48,041 --> 00:26:50,434 You got more guts than half of these guys. 575 00:26:50,521 --> 00:26:51,522 'I don't care what sarge says.' 576 00:26:51,610 --> 00:26:53,046 How you figure that? 577 00:26:53,133 --> 00:26:56,092 You lied about your age to get into the Corps. 578 00:26:56,179 --> 00:26:58,355 I know a lot of guys who lied so they wouldn't have to serve. 579 00:27:00,488 --> 00:27:02,621 Why are you so nice to me, Tully? Huh? 580 00:27:04,797 --> 00:27:06,625 You remind me of my kid brother, I guess. 581 00:27:10,106 --> 00:27:13,936 - Memphis? - Only place I could think of. 582 00:27:14,023 --> 00:27:17,287 If you run now, you'll never stop running. 583 00:27:17,374 --> 00:27:18,854 - I don't know, Tully. - I'm gonna find Max. 584 00:27:18,941 --> 00:27:20,856 I'm gonna make this right. 585 00:27:20,943 --> 00:27:22,597 So you can either get on that bus 586 00:27:22,684 --> 00:27:24,164 or you can go back to the ship 587 00:27:24,251 --> 00:27:26,340 'you can look Sergeant Chaney in the eyes' 588 00:27:26,427 --> 00:27:27,558 and you can tell him the truth. 589 00:27:29,082 --> 00:27:30,692 'The choice is yours.' 590 00:27:33,173 --> 00:27:35,610 [instrumental music] 591 00:27:39,614 --> 00:27:41,529 Hardest thing I ever did.. 592 00:27:41,616 --> 00:27:43,444 ...not getting on that bus. 593 00:27:43,531 --> 00:27:45,141 Shore patrol was waiting 594 00:27:45,228 --> 00:27:46,403 threw me right in the brig. 595 00:27:48,101 --> 00:27:50,233 So, when'd you hear Tully went AWOL? 596 00:27:50,320 --> 00:27:52,671 Oh, that's halfway to Korea, one of the guards told me. 597 00:27:54,411 --> 00:27:55,891 It didn't make a lot of sense, though. 598 00:27:55,978 --> 00:27:58,067 You know if Tully found Max that night? 599 00:27:58,154 --> 00:27:59,721 I don't know. 600 00:27:59,808 --> 00:28:02,332 But if Tully gave you his word on something.. 601 00:28:02,419 --> 00:28:03,943 ...pretty much meant it was gonna happen. 602 00:28:06,162 --> 00:28:09,035 He wasn't just an outstanding Marine.. 603 00:28:09,122 --> 00:28:10,732 ...he was like a brother to me. 604 00:28:12,734 --> 00:28:13,996 "Semper Fi." 605 00:28:17,391 --> 00:28:19,349 Spic and Span time, Max. 606 00:28:19,436 --> 00:28:21,090 You lied to us about seeing Tully. 607 00:28:21,177 --> 00:28:22,744 I said I didn't remember. 608 00:28:22,831 --> 00:28:25,181 That amnesia extend to taking that officer's gun? 609 00:28:25,268 --> 00:28:27,618 You were going to let Snow swing for that. 610 00:28:27,706 --> 00:28:29,838 Only Tully wasn't going to let that happen. 611 00:28:29,925 --> 00:28:31,405 [Lilly] 'He was going to turn you in' 612 00:28:31,492 --> 00:28:33,407 so you shot him before he had the chance. 613 00:28:33,494 --> 00:28:36,802 - You got it all wrong. - You took that officer's gun. 614 00:28:36,889 --> 00:28:38,891 And that's conduct unbecoming the Corps. 615 00:28:38,978 --> 00:28:41,154 So is shooting a guy who was just trying to help a friend. 616 00:28:41,241 --> 00:28:42,633 I'm guilty of a lot of things 617 00:28:42,721 --> 00:28:45,114 being a bad Marine is just one of 'em. 618 00:28:45,201 --> 00:28:46,812 But you can't say the same about Tully. 619 00:28:46,899 --> 00:28:50,032 He was some top-shelf stuff. 620 00:28:50,119 --> 00:28:51,642 ♪ You may have heard of jalopies ♪ 621 00:28:51,730 --> 00:28:53,340 ♪ You've heard the noise they make ♪ 622 00:28:53,427 --> 00:28:56,691 ♪ But let me introduce my new Rocket 88 ♪ 623 00:28:56,778 --> 00:28:58,301 ♪ Yes it's great ♪ 624 00:28:58,388 --> 00:28:59,912 ♪ Just won't wait ♪ 625 00:28:59,999 --> 00:29:02,828 ♪ Everybody likes my Rocket 88.. ♪ 626 00:29:02,915 --> 00:29:04,307 [Max] 'Hey, it's punchy!' 627 00:29:04,394 --> 00:29:06,309 Give me the weapon, Max. 628 00:29:06,396 --> 00:29:07,441 Don't know what you're talking about. 629 00:29:07,528 --> 00:29:09,051 Cut the crap. Snow told me. 630 00:29:09,138 --> 00:29:11,358 Ah. You gonna rat me out? 631 00:29:11,445 --> 00:29:13,795 Of course not. But I need it back. 632 00:29:13,882 --> 00:29:15,884 It was a joke.. 633 00:29:15,971 --> 00:29:18,060 ...to mess with Lieutenant Putnam. 634 00:29:18,147 --> 00:29:20,497 Make him think he lost his precious revolver. 635 00:29:20,584 --> 00:29:21,847 A joke? 636 00:29:21,934 --> 00:29:23,239 You know, Snow's thinkin' about going AWOL 637 00:29:23,326 --> 00:29:24,719 because he can't face Sergeant Chaney. 638 00:29:24,806 --> 00:29:26,416 That sound funny to you? 639 00:29:26,503 --> 00:29:29,855 Best thing for our platoon would be for that guy to wash out. 640 00:29:29,942 --> 00:29:30,986 You're wrong about him. 641 00:29:31,073 --> 00:29:33,902 That guy's a walking mortar magnet. 642 00:29:33,989 --> 00:29:36,687 Don't waste your last hours of shore leave on Snow. 643 00:29:36,775 --> 00:29:38,820 Just give me the weapon, Max. 644 00:29:38,907 --> 00:29:40,430 I can't. I pawned it. 645 00:29:42,302 --> 00:29:43,956 How do you think I met these friendly ladies? 646 00:29:44,043 --> 00:29:46,001 60 bucks? 647 00:29:46,088 --> 00:29:48,177 How am I supposed to get that kind of money? 648 00:29:48,264 --> 00:29:50,136 - How much you got? - Ten. 649 00:29:50,223 --> 00:29:53,313 I was gonna use it to buy something special for Nora. 650 00:29:53,400 --> 00:29:56,620 Don't worry. Hi. I'll chip in. 651 00:30:00,755 --> 00:30:03,627 ["Rocket 88" saxophone music] 652 00:30:05,238 --> 00:30:06,587 I'm not proud of what I did 653 00:30:06,674 --> 00:30:08,719 but I never saw Tully with that pistol. 654 00:30:08,807 --> 00:30:10,896 So he doesn't show for the boat ride to Korea 655 00:30:10,983 --> 00:30:12,201 and you don't say a word? 656 00:30:12,288 --> 00:30:14,334 I thought maybe he took off with that girl 657 00:30:14,421 --> 00:30:15,814 he was so hot to get back to. 658 00:30:15,901 --> 00:30:20,079 It's what I'd have done. Back when I could run. 659 00:30:20,166 --> 00:30:22,995 We've got a gun, but no one who saw Tully with it. 660 00:30:23,082 --> 00:30:26,172 So Tully leaves Max and what, gets the gun out of hock? 661 00:30:26,259 --> 00:30:28,087 But he'd need money for that. 662 00:30:28,174 --> 00:30:29,653 I think I know where he got it. 663 00:30:29,740 --> 00:30:31,090 Tully did find Nora later that night. 664 00:30:31,177 --> 00:30:32,439 How do you figure? 665 00:30:32,526 --> 00:30:34,093 Well, something wasn't sitting right 666 00:30:34,180 --> 00:30:36,660 so I checked into Ben Conlin, Nora's late husband. 667 00:30:36,747 --> 00:30:37,966 - The Navy officer. - Yeah. 668 00:30:38,053 --> 00:30:39,315 Thought if I could put him 669 00:30:39,402 --> 00:30:41,883 and Tully in town at the same time.. 670 00:30:41,970 --> 00:30:43,885 But he was stationed in Japan. 671 00:30:43,972 --> 00:30:45,974 Yeah, a dead end till I found this. 672 00:30:49,325 --> 00:30:52,894 Ben Conlin adopted Nora Lee's three month old baby boy. 673 00:30:54,591 --> 00:30:55,941 A month after they got married. 674 00:30:56,028 --> 00:30:58,247 Birth certificate lists the father as "unknown." 675 00:30:58,334 --> 00:31:00,946 Yeah. Math points to Tully 676 00:31:01,033 --> 00:31:03,513 and their romance didn't end in that photo booth. 677 00:31:08,649 --> 00:31:12,653 1952, tough time to be an unwed mother. 678 00:31:12,740 --> 00:31:14,176 The looks you must've gotten. 679 00:31:14,263 --> 00:31:15,961 I don't know what you're talking about. 680 00:31:16,048 --> 00:31:19,703 Come on, Nora, you didn't meet Ben till after Peter was born. 681 00:31:19,790 --> 00:31:22,271 Peter...is Tully's son. 682 00:31:24,447 --> 00:31:25,840 'Got the records to prove it.' 683 00:31:29,757 --> 00:31:31,933 I've never told anyone. 684 00:31:32,020 --> 00:31:33,804 Not even Peter. 685 00:31:33,892 --> 00:31:35,502 You lied about seeing Tully again. 686 00:31:35,589 --> 00:31:37,983 Makes it hard for me to believe anything you say now. 687 00:31:38,070 --> 00:31:39,462 What choice did I have? 688 00:31:39,549 --> 00:31:41,682 So I start thinking, maybe Tully does go AWOL 689 00:31:41,769 --> 00:31:44,685 then he finds out you're pregnant and wants to leave you. 690 00:31:44,772 --> 00:31:46,426 No. You can check. 691 00:31:46,513 --> 00:31:50,125 I wrote letters, filed paternity requests with the VA. 692 00:31:50,212 --> 00:31:51,692 I didn't know where Jimmy was, either. 693 00:31:51,779 --> 00:31:53,302 Then tell me what happened. 694 00:31:56,827 --> 00:31:59,918 I waited all night for him to come back 695 00:32:00,005 --> 00:32:02,572 staring out my window, praying to God. 696 00:32:03,834 --> 00:32:06,185 And then, there he was. 697 00:32:08,839 --> 00:32:11,277 [instrumental music] 698 00:32:17,239 --> 00:32:18,545 Nora. 699 00:32:18,632 --> 00:32:20,590 Oh, I never thought I'd see you again. 700 00:32:25,639 --> 00:32:27,380 What's bothering you, Jimmy? 701 00:32:27,467 --> 00:32:29,991 Nothing. It's just.. 702 00:32:30,078 --> 00:32:31,427 I'm here. 703 00:32:31,514 --> 00:32:34,343 What happened with shore patrol? Spill. 704 00:32:34,430 --> 00:32:36,432 I just want to make the most of our last hours together. 705 00:32:36,519 --> 00:32:38,565 Just let me look at you. 706 00:32:38,652 --> 00:32:40,045 You gotta be straight with me. 707 00:32:40,132 --> 00:32:41,394 Something's eating at you. 708 00:32:43,352 --> 00:32:46,007 They're looking for a friend of mine. 709 00:32:46,094 --> 00:32:47,617 A friend who didn't do what they're saying he did. 710 00:32:49,706 --> 00:32:51,752 And, uh, I tried to help him. 711 00:32:53,884 --> 00:32:56,626 - I couldn't. - Why couldn't you? 712 00:32:56,713 --> 00:32:59,368 Because I don't have the money to prove he's innocent. 713 00:32:59,455 --> 00:33:00,979 And if you had the money 714 00:33:01,066 --> 00:33:03,111 you could use it to help your friend? 715 00:33:05,374 --> 00:33:07,333 Look, if I help him.. 716 00:33:07,420 --> 00:33:09,161 ...and he dies over there.. 717 00:33:09,248 --> 00:33:11,685 You don't know the future. 718 00:33:11,772 --> 00:33:13,600 You can only follow your gut 719 00:33:13,687 --> 00:33:16,733 like you did following me into that bar and.. 720 00:33:16,820 --> 00:33:18,866 ...pestering me for a dance. 721 00:33:21,303 --> 00:33:24,263 I can be pretty persistent when I need to be. 722 00:33:32,358 --> 00:33:34,012 What is this? 723 00:33:34,099 --> 00:33:37,145 My mother wore it on her wedding day. It's gotta be worth more 724 00:33:37,232 --> 00:33:38,190 than whatever's behind that pawn ticket. 725 00:33:38,277 --> 00:33:39,408 Nora, I can't-- 726 00:33:39,495 --> 00:33:40,975 I don't wanna hear another word. 727 00:33:47,721 --> 00:33:49,505 Look, it's not worth a lot 728 00:33:49,592 --> 00:33:52,682 but, it's been in my family for a long time. 729 00:33:56,512 --> 00:33:59,124 - Will you keep this for me? - Yes. 730 00:34:01,865 --> 00:34:04,129 I'll be waiting for you at the docks, before we push off. 731 00:34:07,219 --> 00:34:08,350 Wait, wait. 732 00:34:12,876 --> 00:34:18,230 I waited by the docks to see him one last time but.. 733 00:34:18,317 --> 00:34:19,535 Tully didn't leave you.. 734 00:34:20,928 --> 00:34:22,190 ...he was taken from you. 735 00:34:24,540 --> 00:34:26,020 He was a special man. 736 00:34:27,804 --> 00:34:29,676 One look and I knew what he was made of. 737 00:34:34,333 --> 00:34:36,770 I want his family to have this. 738 00:34:38,206 --> 00:34:41,079 [instrumental music] 739 00:34:45,996 --> 00:34:48,347 This will mean a lot to his kid brother, Steve. 740 00:34:51,785 --> 00:34:52,786 Detective Rush.. 741 00:34:54,527 --> 00:34:56,181 ...Jimmy was the love of my life. 742 00:34:58,226 --> 00:35:00,054 Thank you for giving that back to me. 743 00:35:05,712 --> 00:35:08,541 So, Tully uses Nora's necklace to get the gun out of hock. 744 00:35:08,628 --> 00:35:09,933 And Tully was a hard charger. 745 00:35:10,020 --> 00:35:11,326 Goes back to the ship, puts the weapon 746 00:35:11,413 --> 00:35:12,936 back in Putnam's locker or returns it 747 00:35:13,023 --> 00:35:14,460 to his platoon sergeant. 748 00:35:14,547 --> 00:35:16,897 Tough play, either way. 749 00:35:16,984 --> 00:35:20,030 He digs, he scores. You were right, boss. 750 00:35:20,118 --> 00:35:22,207 Military doesn't buy a tin of beans or toss a grenade 751 00:35:22,294 --> 00:35:23,686 unless there's a paper trail. 752 00:35:23,773 --> 00:35:26,167 De-requisition order to dispose 753 00:35:26,254 --> 00:35:29,170 of six steel oil drums of hazardous material 754 00:35:29,257 --> 00:35:31,085 from theUSS Pronto. 755 00:35:31,172 --> 00:35:33,783 September ninth. Date matches up. 756 00:35:33,870 --> 00:35:35,655 Stuff like that doesn't get on or off a ship 757 00:35:35,742 --> 00:35:37,352 without the engine room knowing about it. 758 00:35:37,439 --> 00:35:40,703 Hmm. "Mean Gene" Karnow was a machinist mate. 759 00:35:40,790 --> 00:35:42,662 Throw this wrench at him, see how he answers. 760 00:35:42,749 --> 00:35:44,403 This supposed to mean something? 761 00:35:44,490 --> 00:35:46,144 [Nick] Well, the date's of interest. 762 00:35:46,231 --> 00:35:49,016 Especially seeing as how Tully's body was found in an oil drum. 763 00:35:49,103 --> 00:35:50,409 Right, the Marine. 764 00:35:50,496 --> 00:35:51,932 You remember this order? 765 00:35:52,019 --> 00:35:53,673 Yeah, I come back from, uh, shore leave 766 00:35:53,760 --> 00:35:56,110 and there's, uh, a Marine sergeant screaming at me 767 00:35:56,197 --> 00:35:58,243 to get rid of the waste oil drums ASAP. 768 00:35:58,330 --> 00:36:01,420 I tell him I don't take orders from a jarhead. 769 00:36:01,507 --> 00:36:04,988 Navy ship, Navy engine room. 770 00:36:05,075 --> 00:36:06,686 You refused to dump those drums? 771 00:36:06,773 --> 00:36:08,035 Yeah, and in about ten minutes 772 00:36:08,122 --> 00:36:09,950 my chief comes down and chews me out 773 00:36:10,037 --> 00:36:11,734 so I go ahead and get rid of 'em. 774 00:36:11,821 --> 00:36:14,389 This Marine sergeant, his name by any chance Chaney? 775 00:36:14,476 --> 00:36:17,436 Yeah, that's him. Thought he was all hard 776 00:36:17,523 --> 00:36:19,264 but then we get out to rough seas 777 00:36:19,351 --> 00:36:22,876 he's out back puking his guts out over the rail. 778 00:36:22,963 --> 00:36:24,094 Chaney. 779 00:36:27,272 --> 00:36:28,490 Took a look at your medical 780 00:36:28,577 --> 00:36:31,406 and service record books, Sergeant Chaney. 781 00:36:31,493 --> 00:36:34,627 Spent most of your second tour in the field hospitals. 782 00:36:34,714 --> 00:36:36,324 Significant battle fatigue? 783 00:36:36,411 --> 00:36:39,632 You ask me down here to question my service record? 784 00:36:39,719 --> 00:36:43,026 [chuckling] You're way out of your depth, son. 785 00:36:43,113 --> 00:36:44,680 Something must have been eating at you real bad 786 00:36:44,767 --> 00:36:47,161 'cause you never saw any action during your second tour. 787 00:36:47,248 --> 00:36:49,685 You want to ask me something about Tully, ask it 788 00:36:49,772 --> 00:36:52,297 but I will not sit here and have you question 789 00:36:52,384 --> 00:36:54,864 my service to this country. 790 00:36:54,951 --> 00:36:56,170 This interview is over. 791 00:36:57,737 --> 00:36:59,869 If you want, we can cuff you to that chair. 792 00:37:01,436 --> 00:37:03,960 [intense music] 793 00:37:09,314 --> 00:37:11,620 I had an officer like you, a ball-busting son of a bitch. 794 00:37:11,707 --> 00:37:12,752 'I hated that bastard.' 795 00:37:14,884 --> 00:37:16,277 But when it was said and done he just wanted 796 00:37:16,364 --> 00:37:17,713 what was best for his men. 797 00:37:17,800 --> 00:37:20,368 - He had a code. - Best ones do. 798 00:37:20,455 --> 00:37:22,501 Is that why you were trying to wash out PFC Snow? 799 00:37:24,807 --> 00:37:26,374 What the hell does this have to do with Snow? 800 00:37:26,461 --> 00:37:27,767 Answer the question! 801 00:37:27,854 --> 00:37:29,725 Snow didn't belong in the Marines! 802 00:37:29,812 --> 00:37:31,727 And it was your job to sort men like him. 803 00:37:31,814 --> 00:37:33,381 Snow was going to fill up his boots 804 00:37:33,468 --> 00:37:35,078 the very minute he saw those Chinamen 805 00:37:35,165 --> 00:37:36,166 'coming at us in waves.' 806 00:37:36,254 --> 00:37:38,256 Oh, with all due respect, sir 807 00:37:38,343 --> 00:37:39,953 you were wrong about Snow, dead wrong. 808 00:37:40,040 --> 00:37:42,390 He was 15 years old. 809 00:37:42,477 --> 00:37:44,740 'He wanted to be a Marine so bad he lied about his age.' 810 00:37:44,827 --> 00:37:46,655 You buried him behind a desk 811 00:37:46,742 --> 00:37:48,222 and he still made it to the front line. 812 00:37:48,309 --> 00:37:50,398 Awarded the Bronze Star and Navy Cross. 813 00:37:50,485 --> 00:37:53,227 That's a lot of bull. Snow did no such thing. 814 00:37:53,314 --> 00:37:56,361 Account of Private First Class Lenny Snow's 815 00:37:56,448 --> 00:37:58,537 heroic actions during battle. 816 00:37:58,624 --> 00:38:00,843 While you were cooling your heels in a field hospital 817 00:38:00,930 --> 00:38:03,106 this is what a brave Marine was doing. 818 00:38:03,193 --> 00:38:04,891 "During a sudden enemy ambush 819 00:38:04,978 --> 00:38:10,157 "Private First Class Snow unhesitatingly left his foxhole' 820 00:38:10,244 --> 00:38:12,855 "moved through withering fire, and employing his rifle 821 00:38:12,942 --> 00:38:14,553 "inflicted numerous casualties. 822 00:38:14,640 --> 00:38:17,295 "His actions saved the lives of his fellow Marines." 823 00:38:18,383 --> 00:38:20,385 I will not listen to this. 824 00:38:20,472 --> 00:38:21,995 Snow was going to get us all killed over there. 825 00:38:22,082 --> 00:38:25,346 I should know. I've seen it before. 826 00:38:25,433 --> 00:38:27,783 Lenny Snow exemplified the Marine Corps. 827 00:38:27,870 --> 00:38:29,350 Negative! 828 00:38:29,437 --> 00:38:31,744 Then just when you think you got Snow going AWOL 829 00:38:31,831 --> 00:38:33,441 Tully shows up to plead his case 830 00:38:33,528 --> 00:38:35,269 says he knows Lenny didn't take that gun. 831 00:38:35,356 --> 00:38:37,097 - Tully was wrong. - Not about Snow. 832 00:38:37,184 --> 00:38:38,707 He wasn't and you know it. 833 00:38:41,580 --> 00:38:44,322 You're still a Marine. Act like one. 834 00:38:44,409 --> 00:38:47,194 Son of a bitch wouldn't back down. 835 00:38:47,281 --> 00:38:48,891 He threatened to pull rank on me. 836 00:38:49,979 --> 00:38:51,154 On me! 837 00:38:52,547 --> 00:38:55,245 This better be good, Tully. 838 00:38:55,333 --> 00:38:57,160 Getting me out of the rack at this time of night. 839 00:38:57,247 --> 00:38:58,945 Sir. 840 00:38:59,032 --> 00:39:01,861 PFC Snow did not take Lieutenant Putnam's revolver, sir. 841 00:39:01,948 --> 00:39:04,211 - Where did you get this, Tully? - I cannot say, sir. 842 00:39:04,298 --> 00:39:05,647 I didn't copy that. 843 00:39:07,780 --> 00:39:09,695 You will give me that weapon. That is an order. 844 00:39:09,782 --> 00:39:11,697 Sir, I wish only to clear Private Snow's name. 845 00:39:13,176 --> 00:39:17,311 PFC Snow is not worthy of being a Marine. 846 00:39:17,398 --> 00:39:19,835 Snow is a coward and a thief and will not tarnish 847 00:39:19,922 --> 00:39:21,359 the Marine Corps with his presence. 848 00:39:21,446 --> 00:39:24,492 With all due respect to Sergeant Chaney 849 00:39:24,579 --> 00:39:27,016 PFC Snow is neither a coward nor a thief. 850 00:39:27,103 --> 00:39:29,410 You have no idea what it takes to be a Marine. 851 00:39:29,497 --> 00:39:32,413 PFC Snow believes you are trying to wash him out, sir 852 00:39:32,500 --> 00:39:34,502 something that is against Marine Corps tradition. 853 00:39:35,764 --> 00:39:37,940 Do not lecture me about tradition! 854 00:39:40,552 --> 00:39:42,728 Now, you will stand down and give me that weapon. 855 00:39:44,556 --> 00:39:45,644 I can't do that, sir. 856 00:39:45,731 --> 00:39:48,386 You are disobeying orders, PFC Tully! 857 00:39:50,779 --> 00:39:52,128 You will give me that weapon 858 00:39:52,215 --> 00:39:54,783 and you will tell me where PFC Snow is 859 00:39:54,870 --> 00:39:57,133 or I will see to it that your sorry butt is booted back 860 00:39:57,220 --> 00:39:59,527 to whatever ungrateful hole you crawled out of. 861 00:39:59,614 --> 00:40:01,703 Sergeant, I am prepared 862 00:40:01,790 --> 00:40:03,531 to go to Captain Ryan and tell him the truth. 863 00:40:03,618 --> 00:40:04,619 The truth? 864 00:40:06,142 --> 00:40:07,840 And what truth is that? 865 00:40:07,927 --> 00:40:09,319 That you wish to pin the theft 866 00:40:09,407 --> 00:40:11,017 of an officer's weapon on an innocent man. 867 00:40:12,758 --> 00:40:15,413 [intense music] 868 00:40:21,419 --> 00:40:22,768 You will do no such thing. 869 00:40:24,857 --> 00:40:27,816 'Cause I decide which Marines remain in this platoon. 870 00:40:27,903 --> 00:40:29,688 Me and only me. 871 00:40:29,775 --> 00:40:31,603 - Sir, I can't let you do that. - You.. 872 00:40:33,605 --> 00:40:35,128 [grunting] 873 00:40:36,303 --> 00:40:37,565 Sergeant, please. 874 00:40:42,004 --> 00:40:42,962 [gunshot] 875 00:40:44,529 --> 00:40:46,444 [panting] 876 00:40:49,011 --> 00:40:51,884 [instrumental music] 877 00:41:08,466 --> 00:41:11,381 ["Taps" music] 878 00:41:28,224 --> 00:41:30,923 [music continues] 879 00:41:50,986 --> 00:41:53,859 [music continues] 880 00:42:16,011 --> 00:42:18,884 [instrumental music] 881 00:42:42,690 --> 00:42:45,475 [music continues] 882 00:43:07,759 --> 00:43:10,588 [music continues] 883 00:43:31,696 --> 00:43:34,612 [music continues] 884 00:43:58,548 --> 00:44:00,768 [Lilly] Stay tuned for scenes from our next episode. 885 00:44:02,378 --> 00:44:04,642 [theme music] 62459
